definition: to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Some shareholders want him to stay put.
sentences.chinese: 一些股东希望他能留任。

sentences.english: Topolanek continues to govern until a new Czech government can be appointed.
sentences.chinese: 在捷克新政府被任命前，托波拉内克将继续留任总理。

sentences.english: What suggestions do you have for Da Silva to maintain his popularity if he wants to stay in office?
sentences.chinese: 如果卢拉想留任，你对他保持民意的方法有何高见？

sentences.english: The firms' chief executives, Daniel Mudd and Richard Syron, will be replaced, but will stay for a transition period.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司的首席执行官临时留任，但最终会被撤换。

sentences.english: We are very pleased to have the existing Chinese management team of Joyou on board.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴中宇现有的中国管理团队将继续留任。

sentences.english: He was particularly anxious to retain Boisson in control of French West Africa.
sentences.chinese: 他特别关怀要波亚松留任法国的西非的统治者。

sentences.english: The question now is how long Mr Jindal remains in office.
sentences.chinese: 现在的问题是金达尔还能留任多久。

definition: to leave office/to leave one's post
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to ask sb to resign from a post
to keep for use/to retain sth/to keep sb in his job
to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
